explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Route Adherence in Designated Shipping Lanes (applicable to cargo vessels navigating near ODIN 1 and SylWin1; spatial anchor: proximity to structured maritime corridors)
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels of moderate size (100–150 m length, 20–25 m width) with no hazardous cargo and typical draught (6–8 m) are expected to follow fixed, linear routes when transiting established shipping lanes under engine power. This behavior ensures predictable traffic flow, collision avoidance, and compliance with regional navigation protocols. The observed stable speed, minimal heading variation, and consistent course alignment reflect disciplined autopilot use on predefined paths. Unlike curved-route patterns—which suggest maneuvering around obstacles or coastal features—the straight-line trajectory here indicates uninterrupted transit through open waters within the lane network. Given the vessel’s static characteristics and location among major offshore infrastructure, maintaining a constant bearing and speed is operationally optimal and aligns with standard seafaring practice in controlled zones.
'''
